medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain in the epigastric and right upper quadrant radiating to the back, associated with nausea and chills.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began 2 days ago, is sharp, and has been worsening. The patient has experienced chills and began vomiting yesterday. Denies fever. Unable to eat since yesterday. Previous similar pain resolved with Tums. Denies relation of pain to fatty foods.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, Asthma, Seronegative Rheumatoid Arthritis, Osteoarthritis, Anxiety, Obesity, Hypogonadism, Sciatica, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Chronic Back Pain. Past surgical history includes open appendectomy and bilateral inguinal hernias.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of gallbladder, liver, or bleeding problems.
